oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Reba McEntire interview - 1984-01-08
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Reba McEntire (performer), conducted on January 8, 1984.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Reba McEntire talks about always singing as a kid with her family -- Reba talks about cutting her first demo tape and her mother living vicariously through her -- Reba talks about getting attention by singing as a child and that she liked being the center of attention -- Reba talks about taking violin classes in college and learning how to play fiddle in her free time -- Reba talks about getting booed off stage -- Reba talks about the first time one of her songs went to number one -- Reba talks about performing on the Grand Ole Opry and various state fairs -- Reba talks about performing on the Johnny Carson show -- Reba talks about playing with the Tonight Show band -- Reba talks about performing in areas where she has not performed before -- Reba talks about touring all over the United States -- Reba talks about her mother having a lot of albums growing up and they were sources of inspiration -- Reba talks (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Reba; McEntire, Reba, 1955-;
